et: Middle English, from Latin, from Greek {it}kastōr{/it}, from {it}Kastōr{/it} Castor

dt: {bc}the more northern of the two bright stars in Gemini

shortdef: the more northern of the two bright stars in Gemini

dt: {bc}a usually silver table vessel with a perforated top for sprinkling a seasoning (such as sugar or spice)
{bc}a usually revolving metal stand bearing condiment containers (such as cruets, mustard pot, and often shakers) for table use {bc}a cruet stand
{bc}any of a set of wheels or rotating balls mounted in a swivel frame and used for the support and movement of furniture, trucks, and portable equipment
{bc}the slight usually backward tilt from vertical of the axis of the steering mechanism of an automobile for giving directional stability to the front wheels

shortdef: one that casts; especially : a machine that casts type
a usually silver table vessel with a perforated top for sprinkling a seasoning (such as sugar or spice)
a usually revolving metal stand bearing condiment containers (such as cruets, mustard pot, and often shakers) for table use : a cruet stand

dt: {bc}a bitter strong-smelling creamy orange-brown substance that consists of the dried perineal glands of the beaver and their secretion and is used especially by perfumers

shortdef: a bitter strong-smelling creamy orange-brown substance that consists of the dried perineal glands of the beaver and their secretion and is used especially by perfumers —called also castor

dt: {bc}the very poisonous seed of the castor-oil plant

shortdef: the very poisonous seed of the castor-oil plant; also : castor-oil plant

dt: {bc}a pale viscous fatty oil from castor beans used especially as a cathartic and as a lubricant and plasticizer

et: probably from its former use as a substitute for castoreum in medicine
shortdef: a pale viscous fatty oil from castor beans used especially as a cathartic and as a lubricant and plasticizer

dt: {bc}a tropical Old World herb ({it}Ricinus communis{/it}) widely grown as an ornamental or for its oil-rich castor beans

shortdef: a tropical Old World herb (Ricinus communis) widely grown as an ornamental or for its oil-rich castor beans
